channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Shaquille O’Neal must pay $1.8 million to end a years-long class action lawsuit after FTX investors accused him of duping them
item.description: Shaquille O'Neal, and other celebrities like Tom Brady and Stephen Curry, were named in the lawsuit in 2022.

item.title: Nvidia is nixing China from its financial forecasts because U.S. restrictions on chip sales have tightened so much, Jensen Huang says
item.description: The chip executive is “10% politician, 90% CEO,” Wedbush analyst Dan Ives said. “He needs to be cautious on their financial guidance, given the China ...

item.title: Zoom’s CEO says work-life balance doesn’t exist: ‘work is life, life is work’ — but there’s one exception
item.description: The billionaire tech executive admits he’s even given up hobbies to focus on work—but he predicts there may be some relief in sight with a two-day wee...

item.title: One lone passenger survived the deadly Air India crash that killed more than 240: ‘He was disoriented with multiple injuries’
item.description: One passenger who was thrown from the plane survived.

item.title: Ford CEO says rare earth supply is ‘day to day’ after plant halt
item.description: “It’s day to day,” Ford Chief Executive Officer Jim Farley said.

item.title: All is relatively quiet on the bond-market front. Here’s why.
American companies are getting caught up in ICE raids and protests
